p: Neurath (2014) suggests that the deregulation of intestinal CD4 + T-cell subgroups leads to an abnormal immune response to bacterial bacteria in genetically predisposed individuals, as T h1 and Th17 cells increase the production of effector cells and generate an imbalance with regulatory T cells. Thus, a CD pathogen includes the positive activation of multiple cytokines, including TNF-α, IFN-γ, IL-1, IL-2, IL-6, IL-12 and IL-17 [ 3].
